newsitem.title: USA: U S West to ask court to review Minn. order.
newsitem.headline: U S West to ask court to review Minn. order.

text.p: U S West Communications Group said Tuesday it would ask a U.S. District Court to review portions of orders issued by the Minnesota Public Utilities Commission regarding access to its local telephone service market.

At issue are commission decisions on the price and terms under which U S West will give other companies access to its local telephone lines. U S West said AT&T Corp and MCI Communications Co want to provide local service in Minnesota.
U S West said the orders mandate the company provide competitors access to lines for $12.03 per line per month, which it said is substantially below what it costs U S West.
U S West said failed to base pricing decisions on the company's costs.
U S West asserts the commission went beyond the scope of its authority under the federal Telecommunications Act and Minnesota state law.
